intro1.text: Wait! Stop right there, Agent Kelley!

intro5.text: Traitor? Not hardly! Our country was founded on the idea of a self-made man, with no gods, no masters! And, as you have seen, I have certainly made well for myself!

intro6.text: It makes perfect sense. As director of the FBI, I am the most powerful man in the country! Why, I could probably have the President killed if I wanted to!

intro7.text:
Have you noticed that all our law enforcement is focused on the 
Communist threat? That was my doing! The Soviet Union gave me a 
convenient target, and it was so easy to turn that into a Red Scare. Every agent chasing quote-unquote Communist Infiltrators is an agent not chasing my criminal enterprises.

choices.text: Why would you send me after yourself?
How did you get away with this for so long?
Enough gloating, time for you to die!
You're director of the FBI! You have a six-figure salary, isn't that enough?
Money? That's what this is about?

a4.text: Money is one thing, but money is worthless unless you have something worth spending it on. No, this is about something far greater.

a8.text: Yes, garlic. The true devil's lettuce. A vile bulb with a horrific flavour and an even worse smell. Few things have no redeeming qualities at all, but I can safely say that garlic is one of them. You see, I need the money so I can take over the garlic industry, and eradicate that damned plant from our otherwise beautiful Earth forever.

b1.text: I was not lying when I said you were our best agent, Kelley. I was sending you to into a trap. You would die a hero in the line of duty, and I would have you out of my way. A win-win situation, if a morbid one.

choices.text: Ha! It'll take more than that to kill me.

b3.text: Don't count your chickens before they hatch, Kelley. This is not over yet.

c1.text: Honestly, I'm not sure. When I first started this, I was sure that the fine agents of the FBI, the Treasury, the ATF, the DEA, NCIS, et cetera et cetera would track me down and bring me to justice.

c2.text: As time went on and nothing happened, I realized how much I could get away with. It's really shaken my confidence in our criminal justice system.

intro10.text: Gloating? Not hardly. I was merely stalling. You were the dramatic fool who fell for it.

choices.text: Do you really expect me to believe that?

intro14.text: No, Agent Kelley, I expect you to die.
